Trump's policies create a lopsided American economy
subhead: While stock markets reached euphoric highs and the tech sector funneled in billions, worrying warning signs have emerged for an American economy hit by tariffs: persistent inflation, stagnant employment and sluggish consumer spending.

'Robert Kennedy Jr could undo all the strategies that normalized vaccination during the 20th century'
subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, historian Gaëtan Thomas warns of the dangerous passivity of checks and balances in the US in the face of public health decisions made by Donald Trump's administration.

title: In New York, Macron unveils a fellowship program for American students
subhead: The 'Lafayette Fellowship' will welcome 30 outstanding American master's students to France every year. The initiative aims to strengthen French soft power at a time when relations with Washington are increasingly strained.

title: 'China hopes that the booming outdoor economy will help revive sluggish consumer spending'
subhead: After enduring strict lockdown policies in 2020, the urbanized Chinese have now embraced an 'outdoor' lifestyle, to the point of developing an environmental conscience, writes Harold Thibault in his column.

title: 'On the Zucman tax, France is mired in a hysterical debate'
subhead: The right pretends not to see that the ultra-rich are not paying their fair share. The left, meanwhile, is blindly accepting an idea that is solely academic in nature, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

In Italy, tens of thousands hold protests in solidarity with Gaza
subhead: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets across Italy on Monday to 'condemn the genocide in Gaza,' during a day of protests marked by strikes and blockades organized by several unions, echoing the slogan of the French protest movement, Block Everything.

title: Dan Ben-David, economist: 'Israel has broken the roots of its growth'
subhead: The professor at Tel Aviv University warns that years of underinvestment, especially in education, and the rising influence of religious Jews are pushing Israel toward an existential crisis.

title: How Israel tried to halt the wave of recognition of the State of Palestine
subhead: Emmanuel Macron is set to deliver his speech recognizing Palestine on September 22 at the UN headquarters in New York. In retaliation, Israel is considering closing the French consulate in Jerusalem and annexing part of the West Bank.
